medical_history.chief_complaint: Vague abdominal pain that worsened and localized to the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started yesterday with vague abdominal pain. The patient continued to eat normally until the pain worsened last night and became localized to the right lower quadrant, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. Denies any fever, chills, sweats, shortness of breath, dysuria, or other symptoms.
medical_history.family_history: No history of ulcerative colitis or Crohn's disease.
medical_history.social_history: Currently on her period. No prior sexually transmitted infections or pelvic inflammatory disease (PID).
